Key Arguments: The Victorian Government is making a significant investment of $1.3 billion to expand the health system's capacity in response to the coronavirus pandemic.
The investment aims to establish an additional 4,000 ICU beds and secure necessary equipment, staff, and space.
The government is ordering $1.2 billion worth of equipment and consumables, including PPE, to prepare for the pandemic peak.
An in-principle agreement has been reached with private hospital operators to ensure the entire health system operates at full capacity.
Notable Quotes: “All Victorians have to play their part in helping to flatten the curve – everything we do now gives us vital time to prepare our health system for what is to come.”
“This type of investment has never been made in Victoria before and shows the magnitude of what we are preparing to deal with.”
